Description: Pottery oil-lamp with elongated nozzle, central filling hole, concave ring base with wheelmark traces. Locally made Nile silt fabric, pale.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Yorkshire Museum, York. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Close Egyptian parallels dated between 333 BC and 225 BC are in the British Museum (Bailey 1975, British Museum Lamps I, Q522 and Q524 from Naukratis). Late 4th to early 3rd century BC parallel from Alexandria (Blondé 1998, 319-20, no. 4, see no. 5). Blondé, F. 1998. Lampes tournée Hellénistiques du Musée d’Alexandrie, in Empereur, J-Y. (ed.), Commerce et Artisant dans l’Alexandrie Hellénistique et Romaine, Paris, 307-35.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.45) (Phase 3)
